title: Beef Tallow May Soon Show Up On a Menu Near You. Here's What That Means
snippets: Beef tallow, a form of beef fat used in cooking, is becoming more popular in restaurants, including Steak 'n Shake. Advocates highlight its flavor and potential health benefits, although nutritionists caution that seed oils may be healthier. Datassential predicts beef tallow will be featured on 8% of restaurant menus within four years, up from less than 1%. The trend is driven by preferences for less processed foods and the desire for healthier eating options. However, animal fats like tallow have more saturated fatty acids, which can increase cholesterol and heart disease risk. Demand for coo
summary: Beef tallow is gaining popularity in restaurants, with predictions it will appear on 8% of menus in four years, up from less than 1%. Advocates cite its flavor and potential health benefits, but nutritionists warn it contains saturated fatty acids, which may raise cholesterol and heart disease risk. The trend reflects a preference for less processed foods.
